metadata.title: CVE-2021-47062 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: KVM:SVM: Use online_vcpus, not created_vcpus, to iterate over vCPUs Use thekvm_for_each_vcpu() helper to iterate over vCPUs when encrypting VMSAs forSEV, which effectively switches to use online_vcpus instead ofcreated_vcpus. This fixes a possible null-pointer dereference ascreated_vcpus does not guarantee a vCPU exists, since it is updated at thevery beginning of KVM_CREATE_VCPU. created_vcpus exists to allow the bulkof vCPU creation to run in parallel, while still correctly restricting themax number of max vCPUs.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-47062` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1098.105').
